title: Atropine Dosing for Cholinesterase Inhibitor Toxicity
description: Doses atropine for cholinesterase inhibitor toxicity from prescription drugs, nerve gas, or insecticides

result.name: dosing_recommendation
result.description: Complete atropine dosing recommendations including initial dose and infusion protocol

interpretation.guide: Follow initial dosing recommendations and reassess every 5 minutes for signs of atropinization

references: Howland MA. Antidotes in Depth: Atropine. In: Hoffman RS, Howland MA, Lewin NA, Nelson LS, Goldfrank LR, eds. Goldfrank's Toxicologic Emergencies. 10th ed. New York, NY: McGraw-Hill; 2015.

Abedin MJ, Sayeed AA, Basher A, Maude RJ, Hoque G, Faiz MA. Open-label randomized clinical trial of atropine bolus injection versus incremental boluses plus infusion for organophosphate poisoning in Bangladesh. Clin Toxicol (Phila). 2012 Jun;50(5):433-40.

Eddleston M, Dawson A, Karalliedde L, Dissanayake W, Hittarage A, Azher S, et al. Early management after self-poisoning with an organophosphorus or carbamate pesticide - a treatment protocol for junior doctors. Crit Care. 2004 Dec;8(6):R391-7.
formula: Initial dose: Pediatric = 0.02 mg/kg (up to adult max); Adult mild = 1-2 mg; Adult severe = 3-5 mg. Double dose every 5 minutes until atropinization achieved. Continuous infusion = 10% of total initial doses per hour.
notes: Large cumulative doses may be necessary
Atropinization endpoints: clear lung exam, HR >80, SBP >80
